description: '''Reggae''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|r|ɛ|g|eɪ|audio=En-us-reggae.ogg}}) is a [[music genre]] that originated in [[Jamaica]] in the late 1960s. The term also refers to the modern popular [[music of Jamaica]] and its [[Jamaican diaspora|diaspora]]. The 1968 single by [[Toots and the Maytals]] "[[Do the Reggay]]" was the first popular song to use the word ''reggae'', effectively naming the genre and introducing it to a global audience.
